title: 103_s1710
content: Extension of suspension of duty on certain chemicals. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended by changing the date from "12/31/92" to "12/31/94" for various chemicals including p-Toluenesulfonyl chloride, 2,6-Dichlorobenzaldehyde, and others. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include various chemicals such as naphthalenesulfonic acid, 3,3'-Dimethoxybenzidine, 2-Amino-5-nitrophenol, 1-Amino-2,4-dibromoanthraquinone, and others. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to include various chemicals like naphthalenesulfonic acid, 3,3'-Dimethoxybenzidine, 2-Amino-5-nitrophenol, and 1-Amino-2,4-dibromoanthraquinone. Additionally, other chemicals such as 3-Methyl-5-pyrazolone, 2-Amino-N-ethylbenzenesulfonoanilide, and 7-Hydroxy-1,3-naphthalenedisulfonic acid are also included. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes various chemicals like naphthalenesulfonic acid, 3,3'-Dimethoxybenzidine, 2-Amino-5-nitrophenol, and 1-Amino-2,4-dibromoanthraquinone, among others. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States now includes various chemicals such as 1,4-Diamino-2,3-dihydroanthraquinone, 1-Amino-2-bromo-4-hydroxyanthraquinone, 4-Aminoacetanilide, and others. The amendments made by section 1 of this Act regarding the effective date apply to goods entered or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption after the 15th day following the enactment date. A retroactive provision allows for the adjustment of duties on entries or withdrawals made after December 31, 1992, but before the 15th day after enactment, if lower duties would have applied.
